textblock.text:
Obtain in your inventory then place all blocks in one area.
1 --- All required blocks (or their equivalent item form) must enter your inventory during the run.
2 --- All required blocks must be placed in the same general area. You cannot place blocks down randomly as you travel, you must manage your inventory and bring them back to a central location of your choosing for placing.
3 --- All required blocks must exist in the world at the same time at the end of the run. For example, you can't re-dye the same shulker box repeatedly, you must have all 17 of them placed on the ground at the same time.
In addition to these requirements, runs are verified using the general game rules specified by the MCSR moderators
Left-click unplaced blocks to bookmark them red. (good for staying organized)
Blocks will automatically light up gold once placed down anywhere in the world.
Left-click to confirm blocks after placing them at your chosen central location.
Drag left-click to multiselect blocks for highlighting. (great for stuff like wood)
Hold right-click to see a close up view of a block, as well as its name.

Creepers become charged when struck by lightning and will cause zombies, skeletons, or other creepers killed by their explosion to drop a mob head. A single charged creeper can't drop more than one head, even if multiple mobs are killed by the explosion.
Use a channeling trident, not lightning rods. If you're in a desert or another biome with no rain the charged creepers may burn to death if you don't extinguish them with a water bucket in time.

Only the waxed versions of each copper block are required. If you wax them by right clicking with honeycomb you must pick them back up to obtain them in your inventory then re-place them, so crafting directly is recommended to save time.
To maximize oxidation speed, space out your copper 4 blocks away from each other. Having them any closer significantly slows the process. When spaced optimally it should take ~20 minutes for a block to oxidize 1 level. Oxidation levels can be peeled back by right clicking with an axe.

Found in Taiga village houses. Always remember to check for this block, it can be quite rare.
Using bone meal to generate large ferns doesn't count, you must obtain it in your inventory then directly place it down.

Found in Savanna village houses.
Using bone meal to generate tall grass doesn't count, you must obtain it in your inventory then directly place it down.
Only under Mountains, Frozen Peaks, and Windswept Hills.
Optimal Depth: Y=-5 to Y=0 (0.0035% chance)
Optimal Depth: Y=0 to Y=5 (0.037% chance)
Optimal Depth: Y=14 to Y=18 (0.042% chance)
Digging long, straight tunnels and detonating TNT is by far the fastest method to expose ancient debris. Strip mining with an insta-break pick is also faster than bed mining.

text_block.text: Bastion Chest Loot Tables (odds per chest in 1.19)

textblock.text: These blocks are only obtainable in creative mode or by using commands, so they are not required to complete the category
These 'blocks' are actually entities, so they are not required
Minecraft doesn't save the 'Times Used' stat for lily pads for some reason
